lead_paragraph: Dominik Hasek, the goaltender known as the Dominator, retired Monday because he said he lacked the motivation for a 17th season. His announcement came five days after Detroit won the Stanley Cup in six games over Pittsburgh. Hasek, a six-time Vezina Trophy winner as the N.H.L.’s top goaltender and a two-time Hart Trophy winner as the league’s most valuable player, leaves on a mixed note. Hasek, 43, the only goalie to win the M.V.P. award twice, lost his job during Detroit’s run to the Cup. He was benched in favor of Chris Osgood.
